privacyLaws.lawName: Texas Data Privacy and Security Act (TDPSA)
privacyLaws.description: The Texas Data Privacy and Security Act, or TDPSA, seeks to govern how corporations gather, utilize, and handle Texas consumers' personal data.

personalDataCategories: Personal data collected from a known child

individualRights.name: Right to Know if a controller is processing the consumerâ€™s personal information
Right to Opt Out of targeted advertising, sale of personal data, profiling, automated decision making
Right to Opt-in consent for certain types of data processing

notice.description: A controller shall provide consumers with a reasonably accessible and clear privacy notice

purposeLimitation.description: Personal data processed by a controller under this subchapter may not be processed for any purpose other than a purpose listed in this subchapter unless otherwise allowed by this chapter

dataMinimization.description: A controller shall limit the collection of personal data to what is adequate, relevant, and reasonably necessary in relation to the purposes for which that personal data is processed, as disclosed to the consumer

securityReqs.description: A controller for purposes ofAprotecting the confidentiality, integrity, and accessibility of personal data, shall establish, implement, and maintain reasonable administrative, technical, and physical data security practices that are appropriate to the volume and nature of the personal data at issue.

processorReqs.description: The processor must follow the instructions of the controller and assist the controller in meeting its obligations under the relevant chapter

riskImpact.description: A data protection assessment conducted must: identify and weigh the direct or indirect benefits that may flow from the processing to the controller, the consumer, other stakeholders, and the public, against the potential risks to the rights of the consumer associated with that processing, as mitigated by safeguards that can be employed by the controller to reduce the risks

breachNotification.description: Notification required following breach of security of computerized data

exemptions.description: A state agency or a political subdivision of this state
Financial institution or an affiliate of a financial institution governed by, or personal data collected, processed, sold, or disclosed in accordance with the GLBA
Covered entity or business associate as defined in the privacy regulations of HIPAA
Institutions of higher education are exempted

exemptions.type: Electric utilities, a power generation companies, or a retail electric providers
exemptions.description: Terms are defined by Section 31.002, Utilities Code

enforcement.penalties: A person who violates this chapter is liable for a civil penalty in an amount not to exceed $7,500 for each violation
enforcement.privateRightOfAction: This chapter may not be construed as providing a basis for, or being subject to, a private right of action for a violation of this chapter or any other law

threshold.description: A business that processes or engages in the sale of personal data and is not a small business as defined by the SBA, which is an independent business having fewer than 500 employees

otherPrivacyLaws.lawName: Texas Identify Theft Enforcement and Protection Act
otherPrivacyLaws.description: The Texas Identify Theft Enforcement and Protection Act addresses the unauthorized use of identifying information and identity theft
The Texas Medical Records Privacy Act prevents the publication of private medical data and sensitive health information for commercial purposes without the consent of the individual in question.
